name: G√©n√©rer des descriptions d'entreprise structur√©es avec Bedrijfsdata Web RAG & OpenAI
description:
*Ce flux de travail contient des n≈ìuds communautaires qui ne sont compatibles qu'avec la version auto-h√©berg√©e de n8n.*

Ce mod√®le g√©n√®re un contenu d'entreprise synth√©tique structur√© en utilisant des donn√©es web en direct de l'API Bedrijfsdata.nl combin√©es avec un LLM. Fournissez un domaine d'entreprise (directement ou via un ID Bedrijfsdata.nl) et le flux de travail r√©cup√®re le contenu pertinent du site web et des moteurs de recherche, puis produit des descriptions pr√™tes √† l'emploi de l'entreprise, de ses offres et de son public cible.

‚ú® **Fonctionnalit√©s**

- Cr√©ez des descriptions d'entreprise en n√©erlandais de haute qualit√© √† la demande
- R√©cup√©rez automatiquement du contenu web en direct via Bedrijfsdata.nl RAG Domaine & RAG Recherche
- Sortie JSON structur√©e pour une utilisation coh√©rente en aval (par exemple, mises √† jour CRM, qualification de leads)
- D√©clencheur flexible : ex√©cutez √† partir de l'ID ProspectPro, d'une entr√©e de domaine ou d'un autre flux de travail
- Structure s√©curis√©e, modulaire et extensible (gestion des erreurs incluse)

üè¢ **Exemple de sortie**
Le flux de travail produit des champs de contenu structur√©s que vous pouvez utiliser directement dans vos ventes, marketing ou flux d'enrichissement :

- **company_description** ‚Äì r√©sum√© de 1 √† 2 paragraphes de l'entreprise
- **products_and_services** ‚Äì aper√ßu d√©taill√© des offres
- **target_audience** ‚Äì caract√©ristiques sp√©cifiques des clients id√©aux (par exemple, secteur, emplacement, taille de l'entreprise, utilisation de logiciels)

**Exemple :**

```
{
  "company_description": "Bedrijfsdata.nl B.V. est une entreprise n√©erlandaise qui fournit des donn√©es compl√®tes sur plus de 3,7 millions d'entreprises aux Pays-Bas...",
  "products_and_services": "L'entreprise offre un acc√®s API aux profils d'entreprise, des analyses sectorielles et des donn√©es SEO...",
  "target_audience": "PME n√©erlandaises ayant besoin d'informations d'entreprise √† jour pour des fins marketing ou commerciales..."
}
```

‚öô **Exigences**

- Instance n8n ou espace de travail cloud
- Installer le n≈ìud communautaire v√©rifi√© Bedrijfsdata.nl n8n
- Identifiants API OpenAI (test√© avec gpt-4.1-mini et gpt-3.5-turbo)
- Compte d√©veloppeur Bedrijfsdata.nl (essai gratuit de 14 jours, 500 cr√©dits)

üîß **Instructions de configuration**

**1. Configuration du d√©clencheur**
- Utilisez l'ID Bedrijfsdata.nl (par d√©faut) ou fournissez un domaine directement
- Peut √™tre appel√© depuis un autre flux de travail en utilisant ‚ÄúEx√©cuter le flux de travail‚Äù

**2. Configurer les identifiants API**

- Cl√© API Bedrijfsdata.nl

- Cl√© API OpenAI

**3. Personnaliser la sortie** (Optionnel)

- Ajustez l'invite dans le n≈ìud LLM pour cr√©er d'autres types de contenu synth√©tique
- √âtendez le sch√©ma de sortie structur√© pour votre cas d'utilisation

**4. Int√©grer avec votre stack**

- N≈ìud d'exemple inclus pour mettre √† jour les descriptions HubSpot
- Remplacez ou √©tendez pour correspondre √† votre CRM, base de donn√©es ou outils de messagerie

üîê **Notes de s√©curit√©**

- Validation des entr√©es pour le domaine requis
- Branches d'erreur d√©di√©es pour les entr√©es invalides, les erreurs API, les erreurs LLM et les erreurs d'int√©gration en aval
- V√©rifications de contenu RAG avant d'ex√©cuter le LLM

üß™ **Tests**
- Ex√©cutez le flux de travail avec un ID Bedrijfsdata.nl li√© √† une entreprise avec un site web connu
- Examinez la sortie JSON g√©n√©r√©e
- V√©rifiez l'exactitude du contenu avant une utilisation en production

üìå **√Ä propos de Bedrijfsdata.nl**
Bedrijfsdata.nl g√®re la base de donn√©es d'entreprises la plus compl√®te des Pays-Bas. Avec des donn√©es en temps r√©el sur plus de 3,7 millions d'entreprises et des API pr√™tes pour l'IA, nous aidons les PME n√©erlandaises √† enrichir leur CRM, leurs flux de travail et leur automatisation marketing. Forts de plus de 25 ans d'exp√©rience dans la collecte et l'enrichissement de donn√©es, notre technologie apporte une qualit√© de donn√©es de niveau entreprise √† chaque organisation.

**Site Web :** https://www.bedrijfsdata.nl
**D√©veloppeurs :** https://developers.bedrijfsdata.nl
**Docs API :** https://docs.bedrijfsdata.nl

üìû **Support**
**Email :** klantenservice@bedrijfsdata.nl
**T√©l√©phone :** +31 20 789 50 50
**Heures de support :** Lundi‚ÄìVendredi, 09:00‚Äì17:00 CET

workflow.name: TEMPLATE - Create Synthetic Content by Prospect ID

parameters.content:
## Step 1: start with a domain name
You can define your trigger however you like. There's only one requirement: this workflow NEEDS a domain name. As the use case we demonstrate in this template is all about creating human-readable information about companies, we've chosen to start with a company profile.

You can adjust these settings in this section.

**Important:** as nodes are referenced in the upcoming code node, you need to replace these references when making changes.

## Step 2: Get live web content
We use 2 different services to retrieve live content from the web:
1. RAG Domain - Retrieves content from the company's website. Service by [Bedrijfsdata.nl Developer Platform](https://developers.bedrijfsdata.nl).
2. RAG Search - Retrieves search engine results. Service by [Bedrijfsdata.nl Developer Platform](https://developers.bedrijfsdata.nl).


For "simple" use cases like the one demonstrated in this template, we filter out 90% of the content collected. For more complex cases, you'll need to make adjustments in the "Prepare content to feed to LLM"-node (and in the prompt later on).

**Important 1:** the more content you provide to the LLM, the more complex your use cases can be. It also increases token usage.

**Important 2:** RAG may fail when the website you want to retrieve content from isn't SEO friendly. **ALWAYS** check if required content is available before executing the LLM-node.

parameters.q: ={{ $('Company domain is required').item.json.name }} {{ $('Company domain is required').item.json.domain }}

parameters.content:
## Step 3: Create synthetic content
Prompt is set up in such a way it doesn't need changing for simple use cases. You can simply define the content you need in the **Structured Output Parser**, as demonstrated in this template.

For more complex use cases, you'll need to adjust both the prompt and the output parser.

**Important:** always set a token limit and monitor your token usage during development to avoid unpleasant surprises.

**Important 2:** the RAG approach has allowed us to generate amazing results with very cheap models, such as gpt-3.5-turbo. Try it!

messageValues.message:
You assist data engineers in creating parts of company profiles. These profiles are used by people in various professions to assist them in their daily tasks. Stakeholders will define the insights they require. The data engineers will provide you with data and content they've gathered from various online sources. You will combine your general knowledge with the provided input to generate insights. As the input you'll get from the data engineers will not cover all inquiries, you're going to have to read between the lines without making things up.  

Additional requirements:
- Always output textual values in Dutch (NL)
- Always adhere to JSON structure that's provided

parameters.content:
## Step 4: Use your synthetic content
Congratulations, your synthetic content is ready! You can use it however you like, like:

- Add it to your CRM to improve your sales workflow
- Telegram it to yourself for manual evaluation
- Process it to automatically qualify prospects
- Etc...

# Create Synthetic Content on Demand
This workflow utilizes Web RAG & LLM to create synthetic content. It's up to you to determine what (type of) content you want to make: this workflow helps you obtain live website content and feed it into an LLM of your choosing. Simply modify the prompt and use the data and/or content the LLM generates however you like.

**Important:** This workflow **only requires a domain name**. You can remove the "Get Company"-node and replace it with another source. Or you could just have the domain name provided by another workflow (this principle is shown in the trigger, just replace "id" with "domain").

### What can you create?
Over hundreds of thousands of executions, this workflow has proven itself to be a highly reliable source of custom data-points and content. Here are a couple of things we've already asked it to do:

- Create a company summary (included in this template)
- Create a high-level overview of products/services a company offers (included in this template)
- Create a detailed description of a company's target audience (included in this template)
- Create a personalized sales pitch for a company
- Determine whether a company is b2b, b2c or a combination of these
- Determine whether a company matches a specific target audience or niche
- Determine whether a company is a family business (or not)
- Determine whether a company is a SaaS company


We've also used this same structure to complete more complex tasks, like creating a **business model canvas**. Tasks like these require modification of the RAG data consumed by the LLM, as well as less-generic prompting.

The principles used in this template can also be used to generate **images** or **videos**, but we've not yet implemented such a use case at scale. Please share your results with us on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/bedrijfsdata-nl/) if you decide to do so:).

### Important links
Bedrijfsdata.nl Developers Platform: https://developers.bedrijfsdata.nl
Bedrijfsdata.nl API docs: https://www.bedrijfsdata.nl

## Example 1: Summary (included)
![](https://www.bedrijfsdata.nl/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/Schermafbeelding-2025-08-13-om-20.27.21.png#full-width)

## Example 2: Business Analysis
![](https://www.bedrijfsdata.nl/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/Schermafbeelding-2025-08-13-om-20.26.24.png#full-width)

nodes.name: Prepare content to feed to LLM

parameters.content:
## Error handling
Please always handle potential errors properly.

**For example**: log in Google Sheet, send Slack/Telegram/email notification.

main.node: Prepare content to feed to LLM

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
